definition: to draw close to
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.english: China cannot not get closer to the rest of the world.
sentences.chinese: 中國不能不向世界上的其他國家靠攏。

sentences.english: Slowly aligning your actions and thoughts towards your goals.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地，你的行爲和思想將會與你的目標靠攏。

sentences.english: Keeply look out for vessels and fishing boats not to approach too close to them.
sentences.chinese: 敏銳的瞭望船隻和漁船，切勿過於靠攏。

sentences.english: Also, inclusion of data modeling and alignment with WS Standards.
sentences.chinese: 此外，還包含了數據建模和向WS標準的靠攏。

sentences.english: Children have to learn to close up the letters when writing.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們寫字時應學會將字母相互靠攏。

sentences.english: The sergeant-major ordered the men to close up.
The sergeant told the men to close up.
We'll pull alongside the ship and put a salvage crew aboard.
sentences.chinese: 我們要靠攏那艘船，把打撈人員送上船去。

sentences.english: These bull- dogs' heads approached each other closely and whispered together.
sentences.chinese: 這些猛犬的頭靠攏在一起，低聲說話。

sentences.english: When a targeted depreciation, you can be close to another location .
sentences.chinese: 當一種定位貶值時，你可以往另一種定位上靠攏。
